name: QXmlEdit
tagline: Simple XML editor. Source code from code.google.com/p/qxmledit for new developments
body:
QXmlEdit is a simple XML editor written in qt4. Its main features are unusual data visualization modes, nice XML manipulation and presentation and it is multi platform. It can split very big XML files into fragments, and compare XML files. It is one of the few graphical Open Source XSD viewers.

Notably QXmlEdit can split very huge XML files with a set of configurable parameters and output options as shown in [this tutorial](http://qxmledit.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/tutorials/splitFiles.pdf).

Latest release is 0.8.14, and its main new feature is a data anonymization tool.

## Moving to GitHub
Soon the Google Code project site will be not available, new developments will be hosted by GitHub.
The new address is:
(https://github.com/lbellonda/qxmledit)

The move is not yet complete, the old Google Code site will be redirected automatically at the end of the migration.

##[Get QXmlEdit](https://sourceforge.net/projects/qxmledit/files/QXmlEdit-0.8.14)
Direct download link is [Download Page with external links](https://code.google.com/p/qxmledit/wiki/Downloads?tm=2)

Download also present on sourceforge.net:
(https://sourceforge.net/projects/qxmledit/files/)

Main features:
  * Hierarchical customizable view of XML elements.
  * Fast XML hierarchy navigation.
  * Split of big XML files.
  * Search supporting XPath expressions.
  * Base 64 data handling.
  * Custom visualization styles.
  * XML Schema (XSD) viewer.
  * Columnar view.
  * Sessions handling.
  * Graphical XML file view.
  * Map view of a XML document.
  * Split and fragment extraction of big XML files.
  * Visual compare of XML Schema files.
  * Visual compare of XML files.
  * XML Snippets.
  * XSL specialized mode.
  * Data anonymization.

### Requirements
QT libraries version 4.7 or higher are required.
QT 5 is supported.


###Screenshots
[Data anonymization](http://qxmledit.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/an_main.png)

[XSLT mode summary](http://qxmledit.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/xsltmode.jpg)
